Selecting 2D or 3D Charts

The application Chart window allows you to easily switch from a 2-dimensional (2D) chart of your data (the default display in the Windows client) to a three-dimensional (3D) chart and back again. In the Windows client, the 3D View Properties dialog also allows you to adjust the perspective and depth of the chart.

The Cross-Platform client displays the majority of charts by default in 3D (see table at the bottom of this page for more information). You also have the option to toggle the 3D/2D view in the Cross-Platform client.

The options for both clients are described in the sections below.

Selecting 2D or 3D charts in the Windows Client

To switch between a 2D and a 3D chart:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the 3D button on the Chart window toolbar to create a 3D view of your data.

  3. To return to a 2D chart, click the 3D button again.

To view a chart from a different perspective:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Rotate button on the Chart window toolbar.

    • Click the Chart Options button on the Chart window toolbar, and select 3D View.

    The 3D View Properties dialog opens.

  2. Select both the 3D and the Full 3D View check boxes.

  3. Drag the red bead in the xyz-axes figure in the upper left of the dialog to an x-axis location.

  4. Drag the blue bead in the figure to a y-axis location.

  5. Click Apply.

  6. To exit the dialog box, click OK.

    7. Note: Pie and doughnut charts can be rotated on the x-axis only.

To change the depth displayed in a chart:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Rotate button on the Chart window toolbar.

    • Click the Chart Options button on the Chart window toolbar, and select 3D View.

  2. The 3D View Properties dialog opens. Click the Rotate button on the Chart window toolbar.

  3. Select the 3D check box, but do not select the Full 3D View check box.

  4. Move the slider just above the check boxes to the right for more depth or to the left for less depth. The block figure in the upper right of the dialog changes to represent the currently selected amount of depth.

  5. To further differentiate chart depth, select the Shadows check box to use a shaded color. Clear the check box to use the unshaded color.

  6. Click Apply.

  7. To exit the dialog box, click OK.

Selecting 3D or 2D charts in the Cross-Platform Client

To toggle between a 3D and a 2D chart:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the Toggle 3D View button on the Chart window toolbar to create a 2D view of your data.

  3. To return to a 3D chart, click the Toggle 3D View button again.

To zoom in and out on a chart:

  1. Display a chart. Be sure that the chart type selected is in a view that allows for zooming. Refer to the chart below to see which charts allow zooming.

  2. While holding down CTRL and the left mouse button, move your mouse from left to right to zoom in and out on the chart.

To rotate a chart:

  1. Display a chart. Be sure that the chart type selected is in a view that allows for rotating. Refer to the chart type below to see which charts allow rotating operations.

  2. While holding down SHIFT and the left mouse button, move your mouse in a circular motion to rotate the chart.

 

You can zoom in and out and rotate a chart on its x-y-z axes for all charts that you can view in 3D view. The majority of the charts shown in 2D view do not allow for zoom or rotate operations. The table below summarizes these points and shows the default view for each chart type in the Cross-Platform client.

Chart type 3D - Zoom, rotate 2D - Zoom, rotate Default view
Area Yes No 3D
Bar Yes No 3D
Column Yes No 3D
Bubble No No 2D (3D view not available)
Heat map Yes No 3D
Line Yes No 3D
Pie Yes Yes 3D
Scatter No No 2D (3D view not available)
Stack bar Yes No 3D
Stack column Yes No 3D
